Edit.Name: prpMapFile
Edit.Caption: Map database
Edit.Help: The name of the file (.xcm) containing terrain, topography, and optionally waypoints, their details and airspaces.

Edit.Name: prpWaypointFile
Edit.Caption: Waypoints
Edit.Help: Primary waypoints file. Supported file types are Cambridge/WinPilot files (.dat), Zander files (.wpz) or SeeYou files (.cup).

Edit.Name: prpAdditionalWaypointFile
Edit.Caption: More waypoints
Edit.Help: Secondary waypoints file. This may be used to add waypoints for a competition.

Edit.Name: prpWatchedWaypointFile
Edit.Caption: Watched waypoints
Edit.Help: Waypoint file containing special waypoints for which additional computations like calculation of arrival height in map display always takes place. Useful for waypoints like known reliable thermal sources (e.g. powerplants) or mountain passes.

Edit.Name: prpAirspaceFile
Edit.Caption: Airspaces
Edit.Help: The file name of the primary airspace file.

Edit.Name: prpAdditionalAirspaceFile
Edit.Caption: More airspaces
Edit.Help: The file name of the secondary airspace file.

Edit.Name: prpTerrainFile
Edit.Caption: Terrain file
Edit.Help: The name of the file containing digital elevation terrain data.

Edit.Name: prpTopographyFile
Edit.Caption: Topography file
Edit.Help: Specifies the file defining the topographical features.

Edit.Name: prpAirfieldFile
Edit.Caption: Waypoint details
Edit.Help: The file may contain extracts from enroute supplements or other contributed information about individual waypoints and airfields.

Edit.Name: prpOrientationCruise
Edit.Caption: Cruise orientation
Edit.Help: Determines how the screen is rotated with the glider in cruise

Edit.Name: prpOrientationCircling
Edit.Caption: Circling orientation
Edit.Help: Determines how the screen is rotated with the glider while circling

Edit.Name: prpCirclingZoom
Edit.Caption: Circling zoom
Edit.Help: If enabled, then the map will zoom in automatically when entering circling mode and zoom out automatically when leaving circling mode.

Edit.Name: prpMapShiftBias
Edit.Caption: Map shift reference
Edit.Help: Determines what is used to shift the glider from the map center

Edit.Name: prpGliderScreenPosition
Edit.Caption: Glider position offset
Edit.Help: Defines the location of the glider drawn on the screen in percent from the screen edge.

Edit.Name: prpMaxAutoZoomDistance
Edit.Caption: Max. auto zoom distance
Edit.Help: The upper limit for auto zoom distance.

Edit.Name: prpDisplayTrackBearing
Edit.Caption: Track bearing
Edit.Help: Display the track bearing (ground track projection) on the map. [Off] Disable display of track bearing. [On] Always display track bearing. [Auto] Display track bearing if there is a significant difference to plane heading.

Edit.Name: prpEnableFLARMMap
Edit.Caption: FLARM traffic
Edit.Help: This enables the display of FLARM traffic on the map window.

Edit.Name: prpTrail
Edit.Caption: Trail length
Edit.Help: Determines whether and how long a snail trail is drawn behind the glider

Edit.Name: prpTrailDrift
Edit.Caption: Trail drift
Edit.Help: Determines whether the snail trail is drifted with the wind when displayed in circling mode.

Edit.Name: prpSnailType
Edit.Caption: Trail type
Edit.Help: Sets the type of the snail trail display.

Edit.Name: prpSnailWidthScale
Edit.Caption: Trail scaled
Edit.Help: If set to ON the snail trail width is scaled according to the vario signal.

Edit.Name: prpDetourCostMarker
Edit.Caption: Detour cost markers
Edit.Help: If the aircraft heading deviates from the current waypoint, markers are displayed at points ahead of the aircraft. The value of each marker is the extra distance required to reach that point as a percentage of straight-line distance to the waypoint.

Edit.Name: prpAircraftSymbol
Edit.Caption: Aircraft symbol
Edit.Help: Sets the symbol used for the aircraft. [Simple] Simplified line graphics, black with white contours. [Simple (large)] Enlarged simple graphics. [Detailed] Rendered aircraft graphics.

Edit.Name: prpWindArrowStyle
Edit.Caption: Wind arrow
Edit.Help: Determines the way the wind arrow is drawn on the map. [Arrow head] Draws an arrow head only [Full arrow] Draws an arrow head with a dashed arrow line

Edit.Name: prpWaypointLabels
Edit.Caption: Label format
Edit.Help: Determines how labels are displayed with each waypoint

Edit.Name: prpWaypointArrivalHeightDisplay
Edit.Caption: Arrival height
Edit.Help: Determines how arrival height is displayed in waypoint labels

Edit.Name: prpWaypointLabelSelection
Edit.Caption: Label visibility
Edit.Help: Determines what waypoint labels are displayed for each waypoint (space permitting)

Edit.Name: prpAppIndLandable
Edit.Caption: Landable symbols
Edit.Help: Three styles are available: Purple circles (WinPilot style), a high contrast (monochrome) style, or orange. The rendering differs for landable field and airport. All styles mark the waypoints within reach green.

Edit.Name: prpAppUseSWLandablesRendering
Edit.Caption: Detailed landables
Edit.Help: [Off] Display fixed icons for landables. [On] Show landables with variable information like runway length and heading.

Edit.Name: prpAppLandableRenderingScale
Edit.Caption: Landable size
Edit.Help: A percentage to select the size landables are displayed on the map.

Edit.Name: prpAppScaleRunwayLength
Edit.Caption: Scale runway length
Edit.Help: [Off] Display fixed length for runways. [On] Scale displayed runway length based on real length

Edit.Name: prpEnableTerrain
Edit.Caption: Terrain display
Edit.Help: Draw a digital elevation terrain on the map.

Edit.Name: prpEnableTopography
Edit.Caption: Topography display
Edit.Help: Draw topographical features (roads, rivers, lakes etc.) on the map.

Edit.Name: prpTerrainContrast
Edit.Caption: Terrain contrast
Edit.Help: Defines the amount of Phong shading in the terrain rendering. Use large values to emphasise terrain slope, smaller values if flying in steep mountains.

Edit.Name: prpTerrainBrightness
Edit.Caption: Terrain brightness
Edit.Help: Defines the brightness (whiteness) of the terrain rendering. This controls the average illumination of the terrain.

Edit.Name: prpTerrainRamp
Edit.Caption: Terrain colors
Edit.Help: Defines the color ramp used in terrain rendering.

Edit.Name: prpSlopeShadingType
Edit.Caption: Slope shading
Edit.Help: The terrain can be shaded among slopes to indicate either wind direction, sun position or a fixed shading from north-east.

Edit.Name: prpEnableFLARMGauge
Edit.Caption: FLARM radar
Edit.Help: This enables the display of the FLARM radar gauge. The track bearing of the target relative to the track bearing of the aircraft is displayed as an arrow head, and a triangle pointing up or down shows the relative altitude of the target relative to you. In all modes, the color of the target indicates the threat level.

Edit.Name: prpAutoCloseFlarmDialog
Edit.Caption: Auto close FLARM
Edit.Help: Setting this to "On" will automatically close the FLARM dialog if there is no traffic. "Off" will keep the dialog open even without current traffic.

Edit.Name: prpEnableTAGauge
Edit.Caption: Thermal assistant
Edit.Help: This enables the display of the thermal assistant gauge.

Edit.Name: prpEnableThermalProfile
Edit.Caption: Thermal band
Edit.Help: This enables the display of the thermal profile (climb band) display on the map.

Edit.Name: prpAppGaugeVarioSpeedToFly
Edit.Caption: Speed arrows
Edit.Help: Whether to show speed command arrows on the vario gauge. When shown, in cruise mode, arrows point up to command slow down; arrows point down to command speed up.

Edit.Name: prpAppGaugeVarioAvgText
Edit.Caption: Show average
Edit.Help: Whether to show the average climb rate. In cruise mode, this switches to showing the average netto airmass rate.

Edit.Name: prpAppGaugeVarioMc
Edit.Caption: Show MacReady
Edit.Help: Whether to show the MacCready setting.

Edit.Name: prpAppGaugeVarioBugs
Edit.Caption: Show bugs
Edit.Help: Whether to show the bugs percentage.

Edit.Name: prpAppGaugeVarioBallast
Edit.Caption: Show ballast
Edit.Help: Whether to show the ballast percentage.

Edit.Name: prpAppGaugeVarioGross
Edit.Caption: Show gross
Edit.Help: Whether to show the gross climb rate.

Edit.Name: prpAppAveNeedle
Edit.Caption: Averager needle
Edit.Help: If true, the vario gauge will display a hollow averager needle. During cruise, this needle displays the average netto value. During circling, this needle displays the average gross value.

Edit.Name: prpAutoWind
Edit.Caption: Auto wind
Edit.Help: This allows switching on or off the automatic wind algorithm. When the algorithm is switched off, the pilot is responsible for setting the wind estimate. [Circling] Requires only a GPS source. [ZigZag] Requires an intelligent vario with airspeed output. [Both] Use ZigZag and circling.

Edit.Name: prpExternalWind
Edit.Caption: External wind
Edit.Help: If enabled, then the wind vector received from external devices overrides XCSoar's internal wind calculation.

Edit.Name: prpAutoMcMode
Edit.Caption: Auto MC mode
Edit.Help: This option defines which auto MacCready algorithm is used. [Final glide] adjusts MC for fastest arrival. For OLC sprint tasks, the MacCready is adjusted in order to cover the greatest distance in the remaining time and reach the finish height. [Trending Average] sets MC to the trending average climb rate based on all climbs. [Both] Uses trending average during task, then fastest arrival when in final glide mode.

Edit.Name: prpBlockSTF
Edit.Caption: Block speed to fly
Edit.Help: If enabled, the command speed in cruise is set to the MacCready speed to fly in no vertical air-mass movement. If disabled, the command speed in cruise is set to the dolphin speed to fly, equivalent to the MacCready speed with vertical air-mass movement.

Edit.Name: prpEnableNavBaroAltitude
Edit.Caption: Nav. by baro altitude
Edit.Help: When enabled and if connected to a barometric altimeter, barometric altitude is used for all navigation functions. Otherwise GPS altitude is used.

Edit.Name: prpEnableExternalTriggerCruise
Edit.Caption: Flap forces cruise
Edit.Help: When Vega variometer is connected and this option is true, the positive flap setting switches the flight mode between circling and cruise.

Edit.Name: prpAverEffTime
Edit.Caption: L/D average period
Edit.Help: Here you can decide on how many seconds of flight this calculation must be done. Normally for gliders a good value is 90-120 seconds, and for paragliders 15 seconds.

Edit.Name: prpSafetyAltitudeArrival
Edit.Caption: Arrival height
Edit.Help: The height above terrain that the glider should arrive at for a safe landing.

Edit.Name: prpSafetyAltitudeTerrain
Edit.Caption: Terrain height
Edit.Help: The height above terrain that the glider must clear during final glide.

Edit.Name: prpAbortTaskMode
Edit.Caption: Alternates mode
Edit.Help: Determines sorting of alternates in the alternates dialog and in abort mode: [Simple] The alternates will only be sorted by waypoint type (airport/outlanding field) and arrival height. [Task] The sorting will also take the current task direction into account. [Home] The sorting will try to find landing options in the current direction to the configured home waypoint.

Edit.Name: prpSafetyMacCready
Edit.Caption: Safety MC
Edit.Help: The MacCready setting used, when safety MC is enabled for reach calculations, in task abort mode, for determining arrival altitude at airfields.

Edit.Name: prpRiskGamma
Edit.Caption: STF risk factor
Edit.Help: The STF risk factor reduces the MacCready setting used to calculate speed to fly as the glider gets low, in order to compensate for risk. Set to 0.0 for no compensation, 1.0 scales MC linearly with height.

Edit.Name: prpRoutePlannerMode
Edit.Caption: Route mode
Edit.Help: If set to "None", neither airspace or terrain is used for route planning. If set to "Terrain", routes will avoid terrain; if set to "Airspace", routes will avoid airspace. If set to "Both", routes will avoid airspace and terrain.

Edit.Name: prpRoutePlannerAllowClimb
Edit.Caption: Route climb
Edit.Help: When enabled and MC is positive, route planning allows climbs between the aircraft location and destination.

Edit.Name: prpRoutePlannerUseCeiling
Edit.Caption: Route ceiling
Edit.Help: When enabled, route planning climbs are limited to ceiling defined by greater of current aircraft altitude plus 500 m and the thermal ceiling. If disabled, climbs are unlimited.

Edit.Name: prpTurningReach
Edit.Caption: Reach mode
Edit.Help: How calculations are performed of the reach of the glider with respect to terrain. [Off] Reach calculations disabled. [Straight] The reach is from straight line paths from the glider. [Turning] The reach is calculated allowing turns around terrain obstacles.

Edit.Name: prpFinalGlideTerrain
Edit.Caption: Reach display
Edit.Help: This determines whether the glide reach is drawn as a line on the map area: [Off] Disables display [Line] Draws a dashed line at the glide reach [Shade] Shades terrain outside glide reach

Edit.Name: prpReachPolarMode
Edit.Caption: Reach polar
Edit.Help: This determines the glide performance used in reach, landable arrival, abort and alternate calculations: [Task] Uses task glide polar [Safety MC] Uses safety MacCready value

Edit.Name: prpPolarReferenceMass
Edit.Caption: Reference mass
Edit.Help: Reference weight at which the given polar is valid.

Edit.Name: prpPolarDryMass
Edit.Caption: Dry mass
Edit.Help: Dry mass of the glider (pilot + empty mass).

Edit.Name: prpPolarWingArea
Edit.Caption: Wing area
Edit.Help: Optional specification of the wing area.

Edit.Name: prpMaxManoeuveringSpeed
Edit.Caption: V rough air
Edit.Help: Optional the maximum manoeuvring speed can be entered on this page to prevent the glide computer from commanding unrealistic cruise speeds.

Edit.Name: prpHandicap
Edit.Caption: Handicap
Edit.Help: The handicap factor used for the OnLine Contest scoring.

Edit.Name: prpPolarMaxBallast
Edit.Caption: Max. ballast
Edit.Help: Optional the amount of water ballast XCSoar refers to as 100% ballast. Set to zero if it does not apply.

Edit.Name: prpBallastSecsToEmpty
Edit.Caption: Dump time
Edit.Help: The time in seconds to dump full ballast.

Edit.Name: prpAirspaceDisplay
Edit.Caption: Airspace display
Edit.Help: Controls filtering of airspace for display and warnings. The airspace filter button also allows filtering of display and warnings independently for each airspace class. [All on] All is displayed. [Clip] Only airspace below the clip altitude. [Auto] All within a margin of the glider. [All below] All airspace below the glider.

Edit.Name: prpClipAltitude
Edit.Caption: Clip altitude
Edit.Help: For clip airspace mode, this is the altitude below which airspace is displayed.

Edit.Name: prpAltWarningMargin
Edit.Caption: Margin
Edit.Help: For auto airspace mode, this is the altitude above/below which airspace is included.

Edit.Name: prpAirspaceWarnings
Edit.Caption: Warnings
Edit.Help: Enable/disable all airspace warnings.

Edit.Name: prpWarningTime
Edit.Caption: Warning time
Edit.Help: This is the time before an airspace incursion is estimated at which the system will warn the pilot.

Edit.Name: prpAcknowledgementTime
Edit.Caption: Acknowledge time
Edit.Help: This is the time period in which an acknowledged airspace warning will not be repeated.

Edit.Name: prpAirspaceOutline
Edit.Caption: Use black outline
Edit.Help: Draw a black outline around each airspace rather than the airspace color

Edit.Name: prpAirspaceFillMode
Edit.Caption: Airspace fill mode
Edit.Help: Specifies the mode for filling the airspace area.

Edit.Name: prpAirspaceTransparency
Edit.Caption: Airspace transparency
Edit.Help: If enabled, then airspaces are filled transparently.

Edit.Name: prpStartMaxSpeed
Edit.Caption: Start max. speed
Edit.Help: Maximum speed allowed in start observation zone. Set to 0 for no limit.

Edit.Name: prpStartMaxSpeedMargin
Edit.Caption: Start max. speed margin
Edit.Help: Maximum speed above maximum start speed to tolerate. Set to 0 for no tolerance.

Edit.Name: prpStartMaxHeight
Edit.Caption: Start max. height
Edit.Help: Maximum height based on start height reference (AGL or MSL) while starting the task. Set to 0 for no limit.

Edit.Name: prpStartMaxHeightMargin
Edit.Caption: Start max. height margin
Edit.Help: Maximum height above maximum start height to tolerate. Set to 0 for no tolerance.

Edit.Name: prpStartHeightRef
Edit.Caption: Start height ref.
Edit.Help: Reference used for start max height rule [MSL] Reference is altitude above mean sea level [AGL] Reference is the height above the start point

Edit.Name: prpFinishMinHeight
Edit.Caption: Finish min. height
Edit.Help: Minimum height based on finish height reference (AGL or MSL) while finishing the task. Set to 0 for no limit.

Edit.Name: prpFinishHeightRef
Edit.Caption: Finish height ref.
Edit.Help: Reference used for finish min height rule [MSL] Reference is altitude above mean sea level [AGL] Reference is the height above the finish point

Edit.Name: prpContests
Edit.Caption: On-Line Contest
Edit.Help: Select the rules used for calculating optimal points for the On-Line Contest. The implementation conforms to the official release 2010, Sept.23. [Classic] Up to seven points including start and finish, finish height must not be lower than start height less 1000 meters. [FAI] Conforms to FAI triangle rules. Three turns and common start and finish. No leg less than 28% of total except for tasks longer than 500km: No leg less than 25% or larger than 45%. [League] The most recent contest with Sprint task rules. [Plus] A combination of Classic and FAI rules. 30% of the FAI score are added to the Classic score.

Edit.Name: prpStartType
Edit.Caption: Start point
Edit.Help: Default start type for new tasks you create.

Edit.Name: prpStartRadius
Edit.Caption: Length/Radius
Edit.Help: Default radius or length of the start zone for new tasks.

Edit.Name: prpFinishType
Edit.Caption: Finish point
Edit.Help: Default finish type for new tasks you create.

Edit.Name: prpFinishRadius
Edit.Caption: Length/Radius
Edit.Help: Default radius or length of the finish zone in new tasks.

Edit.Name: prpTurnpointType
Edit.Caption: Turn point
Edit.Help: Default turn point type for new tasks you create.

Edit.Name: prpTurnpointRadius
Edit.Caption: Radius
Edit.Help: Default radius of turnpoint cylinders and sectors in new tasks.

Edit.Name: prpTaskType
Edit.Caption: Task
Edit.Help: Default task type for new tasks you create.

Edit.Name: prpAATMinTime
Edit.Caption: AAT min. time
Edit.Help: Default AAT min. time for new AAT tasks.

Edit.Name: prpAATTimeMargin
Edit.Caption: Optimisation margin
Edit.Help: Safety margin for AAT task optimisation. Optimisation seeks to complete the task at the minimum time plus this margin time.

Edit.Name: prpComPort1
Edit.Caption: Port
Edit.Help: Altair Pro users should set this to Port 3

Edit.Name: prpComSpeed1
Edit.Caption: Baudrate
Edit.Help: Altair Pro or Vega users should set this to 38400.

Edit.Name: BulkBaudRate1
Edit.Caption: Bulk baud rate
Edit.Help: The baud rate used for bulk transfers, such as task declaration or flight download.

Edit.Name: prpComDevice1
Edit.Caption: Driver
Edit.Help: Type of primary device. The primary device should be the most reliable GPS data source.

Edit.Name: prpComPort2
Edit.Caption: Port
Edit.Help: Altair Pro users should set this to Port 1.

Edit.Name: prpComSpeed2
Edit.Caption: Baudrate
Edit.Help: Altair Pro or Vega users should set this to 38400.

Edit.Name: BulkBaudRate2
Edit.Caption: Bulk baud rate
Edit.Help: The baud rate used for bulk transfers, such as task declaration or flight download.

Edit.Name: prpComDevice2
Edit.Caption: Driver
Edit.Help: Type of secondary device. The secondary device may be used as backup GPS data or other data e.g. from an intelligent variometer. Generic can be used for GPS sources including FLARM.

Edit.Name: prpSetSystemTimeFromGPS
Edit.Caption: Use GPS time
Edit.Help: If enabled sets the clock of the computer to the GPS time once a fix is set. This is only necessary if your computer does not have a real-time clock with battery backup or your computer frequently runs out of battery power or otherwise loses time.

Edit.Name: prpIgnoreNMEAChecksum
Edit.Caption: Ignore checksum
Edit.Help: If your GPS device outputs invalid NMEA checksums, this will allow it's data to be used anyway

Edit.Name: prpLoggerTimeStepCruise
Edit.Caption: Time step cruise
Edit.Help: This is the time interval between logged points when not circling.

Edit.Name: prpLoggerTimeStepCircling
Edit.Caption: Time step circling
Edit.Help: This is the time interval between logged points when circling.

Edit.Name: prpLoggerShortName
Edit.Caption: Short file name
Edit.Help: This determines whether the logger uses the short IGC file name or the long IGC file name. Example short name (81HXABC1.IGC), long name (2008-01-18-XXX-ABC-01.IGC).

Edit.Name: prpDisableAutoLogger
Edit.Caption: Auto. logger
Edit.Help: Enables the automatic starting and stopping of logger on takeoff and landing respectively. Disable when flying paragliders.

Edit.Name: prpUnitsSpeed
Edit.Caption: Aircraft/Wind speed
Edit.Help: Units used for airspeed and ground speed. A separate unit is available for task speeds.

Edit.Name: prpUnitsDistance
Edit.Caption: Distance
Edit.Help: Units used for horizontal distances e.g. range to waypoint, distance to go.

Edit.Name: prpUnitsLift
Edit.Caption: Lift
Edit.Help: Units used for vertical speeds (variometer)

Edit.Name: prpUnitsAltitude
Edit.Caption: Altitude
Edit.Help: Units used for altitude and heights.

Edit.Name: prpUnitsTemperature
Edit.Caption: Temperature
Edit.Help: Units used for temperature.

Edit.Name: prpUnitsTaskSpeed
Edit.Caption: Task speed
Edit.Help: Units used for task speeds.

Edit.Name: prpUnitsLatLon
Edit.Caption: Lat./Lon.
Edit.Help: Units used for latitude and longitude.

Edit.Name: prpUTCOffset
Edit.Caption: UTC offset
Edit.Help: The UTC offset field allows the UTC local time offset to be specified. The local time is displayed below in order to make it easier to verify the correct offset has been entered.

Edit.Name: prpInputFile
Edit.Caption: Events
Edit.Help: The Input Events file defines the menu system and how XCSoar responds to button presses and events from external devices.

Edit.Name: prpLanguageFile
Edit.Caption: Language
Edit.Help: The language options selects translations for English texts to other languages. Select English for a native interface or Automatic to localise XCSoar according to the system settings.

Edit.Name: prpStatusFile
Edit.Caption: Status message
Edit.Help: The status file can be used to define sounds to be played when certain events occur, and how long various status messages will appear on screen.

Edit.Name: prpMenuTimeout
Edit.Caption: Menu timeout
Edit.Help: This determines how long menus will appear on screen if the user does not make any button presses or interacts with the computer.

Edit.Name: prpDebounceTimeout
Edit.Caption: Debounce time
Edit.Help: This is the minimum interval between the system recognising key presses. Set this to a low value for a more responsive user interface; if it is too low, then accidental multiple key presses can occur.

Edit.Name: prpTextInput
Edit.Caption: Text input style
Edit.Help: Determines how the user is prompted for text input (filename, teamcode etc.)

Edit.Name: prpAutoBlank
Edit.Caption: Auto. blank
Edit.Help: This determines whether to blank the display after a long period of inactivity when operating on internal battery power.

Edit.Name: prpDisplayOrientation
Edit.Caption: Display orientation
Edit.Help: Rotate the display on devices that support it.

Edit.Name: prpAppInfoBoxGeom
Edit.Caption: Infobox geometry
Edit.Help: A list of possible InfoBox layouts. Do some trials to find the best for your screen size.

Edit.Name: prpAppFlarmLocation
Edit.Caption: Flarm display location
Edit.Help: Choose a location for the flarm display

Edit.Name: prpTabDialogStyle
Edit.Caption: Tab dialog style
Edit.Help: Determines whether tabbed dialogs use text or icons

Edit.Name: prpAppStatusMessageAlignment
Edit.Caption: Msg. window
Edit.Help: Defines the alignment of the status message box, either centered or in the top left corner.

Edit.Name: prpDialogStyle
Edit.Caption: Dialog style
Edit.Help: Determines display size of dialogs.

Edit.Name: prpAppInverseInfoBox
Edit.Caption: Inverse InfoBoxes
Edit.Help: If true, the InfoBoxes are white on black, otherwise black on white.

Edit.Name: prpAppInfoBoxColors
Edit.Caption: Colored InfoBoxes
Edit.Help: If true, certain InfoBoxes will have coloured text. For example, the active waypoint infobox will be blue when the glider is above final glide.

Edit.Name: prpAppInfoBoxBorder
Edit.Caption: InfoBox border
Edit.Help: Two styles for infobox borders are available: [Box] Draws boxes around each infobox. [Tab] Draws a tab at the top of the infobox across the title.

Edit.Name: prpPageLayout0
Edit.Caption: Page 1
Edit.Help: Determines the information displayed on different screen pages.

Edit.Name: prpPageLayout1
Edit.Caption: Page 2
Edit.Help: Determines the information displayed on different screen pages.

Edit.Name: prpPageLayout2
Edit.Caption: Page 3
Edit.Help: Determines the information displayed on different screen pages.

Edit.Name: prpPageLayout3
Edit.Caption: Page 4
Edit.Help: Determines the information displayed on different screen pages.

Edit.Name: prpPageLayout4
Edit.Caption: Page 5
Edit.Help: Determines the information displayed on different screen pages.

Edit.Name: prpPageLayout5
Edit.Caption: Page 6
Edit.Help: Determines the information displayed on different screen pages.

Edit.Name: prpPageLayout6
Edit.Caption: Page 7
Edit.Help: Determines the information displayed on different screen pages.

Edit.Name: prpPageLayout7
Edit.Caption: Page 8
Edit.Help: Determines the information displayed on different screen pages.

Edit.Name: prpAppInfoBoxModel
Edit.Caption: Device model
Edit.Help: Select your PNA model to make full use of its hardware capabilities. If it is not included, use Generic type.
